001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import squidpony.ArrayTools;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility;
005import squidpony.squidmath.*;
006
007import java.io.Serializable;
008import java.util.*;
009
010/**
011 * This class provides methods for calculating Field of View in grids. Field of
012 * View (FOV) algorithms determine how much area surrounding a point can be
013 * seen. They return a 2D array of doubles, representing the amount of view
014 * (typically sight, but perhaps sound, smell, etc.) which the origin has of
015 * each cell. In the returned 2D array, 1.0 is always "fully seen," while 0.0
016 * is always "unseen." Values in between are much more common, and they enable
017 * this class to be used for lighting effects.
018 * <br>
019 * The input resistanceMap is considered the percent of opacity. This resistance
020 * is on top of the resistance applied from the light spreading out. You can
021 * obtain a resistance map easily with the {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
022 * method, which uses defaults for common chars used in SquidLib, but you may
023 * also want to create a resistance map manually if a given char means something
024 * very different in your game. This is easy enough to do by looping over all the
025 * x,y positions in your char[][] map and running a switch statement on each char,
026 * assigning a double to the same x,y position in a double[][]. The value should
027 * be between 0.0 (unblocked) for things light passes through, 1.0 (blocked) for
028 * things light can't pass at all, and possibly other values if you have
029 * translucent obstacles. There's {@link #generateSimpleResistances(char[][])} as
030 * well, which only returns 1.0 (fully blocked) or 0.0 (passable), and 3x3 subcell
031 * variants, which produce a resistance map that is 3 times wider and 3 times
032 * taller than the input map. The subcell variants have especially useful behavior
033 * when using {@link DungeonUtility#hashesToLines(char[][])} to draw a map with
034 * box-drawing characters, since these 3x3 resistance maps will line up blocking
035 * cells to where a box-drawing line is.
036 * <br>
037 * The returned light map is considered the percent of light in the cells.
038 * <br>
039 * All implementations for FOV here (that is, Ripple FOV and Shadow FOV) provide
040 * percentage levels for partially-lit or partially-seen cells. This leads to a
041 * straightforward implementation of soft lighting using an FOV result -- just
042 * mix the background or floor color of a cell, however you represent it, with
043 * a very light color (like pastel yellow), with the percentage of the light
044 * color to mix in equal to the percent of light in the FOV map.
045 * <br>
046 * All solvers perform bounds checking so solid borders in the map are not
047 * required.
048 * <br>
049 * For calculating FOV maps, this class provides both instance methods, which
050 * attempt to reuse the same 2D array for light stored in the object, and static
051 * methods, which take a light 2D array as an argument and edit it in-place.
052 * In older versions of SquidLib, constantly allocating and returning 2D double
053 * arrays on each call dragged performance down, but both of the new methods
054 * should perform well.
055 * <br>
056 * Static methods are provided to add together FOV maps in the simple way
057 * (disregarding visibility of distant FOV from a given cell), or the more
058 * practical way for roguelikes (where a cell needs to be within line-of-sight
059 * in the first place for a distant light to illuminate it). The second method
060 * relies on an LOS map, which is essentially the same as a very-high-radius
061 * FOV map and can be easily obtained with calculateLOSMap().
062 * <br>
063 * If you want to iterate through cells that are visible in a double[][] returned
064 * by FOV, you can pass that double[][] to the constructor for GreasedRegion, and
065 * you can use the GreasedRegion as a reliably-ordered Collection of Coord (among
066 * other things). The order GreasedRegion iterates in is somewhat strange, and
067 * doesn't, for example, start at the center of an FOV map, but it will be the
068 * same every time you create a GreasedRegion with the same FOV map (or the same
069 * visible Coords).
070 * <br>
071 * This class is not thread-safe. This is generally true for most of SquidLib.
072 *
073 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
074 */
075public class FOV implements Serializable {
076    private static final long serialVersionUID = 3258723684733275798L;
077    /**
078     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
079     * It will go around corners a bit. This corresponds to a
080     * {@code rippleLooseness} of 2 in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
081     */
082    public static final int RIPPLE = 1;
083    /**
084     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
085     * It will spread around edges like smoke or water, but maintain a
086     * tendency to curl towards the start position when going around
087     * edges. This corresponds to a {@code rippleLooseness} of 3
088     * in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
089     */
090    public static final int RIPPLE_LOOSE = 2;
091    /**
092     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
093     * It will only go around corners slightly. This corresponds to a
094     * {@code rippleLooseness} of 1 in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
095     */
096    public static final int RIPPLE_TIGHT = 3;
097    /**
098     * Performs FOV by pushing values outwards from the source location.
099     * It will go around corners massively. This corresponds to a
100     * {@code rippleLooseness} of 6 in {@link #reuseRippleFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, int, double, Radius)}.
101     */
102    public static final int RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE = 4;
103    /**
104     * Uses Shadow Casting FOV algorithm. Returns a percentage from 1.0 (center of
105     * FOV) to 0.0 (outside of FOV).
106     */
107    public static final int SHADOW = 5;
108    private int type = SHADOW;
109
110        /**
111         * Data allocated in the previous calls to the public API, if any. Used to
112         * save allocations when multiple calls are done on the same instance.
113         */
114    protected double[][] light;
115        /**
116         * Data allocated in the previous calls to the public API, if any. Used to
117         * save allocations when multiple calls are done on the same instance.
118         */
119    protected GreasedRegion nearLight;
120
121    protected static final Direction[] ccw = new Direction[]
122            {Direction.UP_RIGHT, Direction.UP_LEFT, Direction.DOWN_LEFT, Direction.DOWN_RIGHT, Direction.UP_RIGHT},
123            ccw_full = new Direction[]{Direction.RIGHT, Direction.UP_RIGHT, Direction.UP, Direction.UP_LEFT,
124            Direction.LEFT, Direction.DOWN_LEFT, Direction.DOWN, Direction.DOWN_RIGHT};
125    private static final ArrayDeque<Coord> dq = new ArrayDeque<>();
126    private static final GreasedRegion lightWorkspace = new GreasedRegion(64, 64);
127    private static final OrderedSet<Coord> workingSet = new OrderedSet<>(256, CrossHash.mildHasher);
128
129    /**
130     * Creates a solver which will use the default SHADOW solver.
131     */
132    public FOV() {
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * Creates a solver which will use the provided FOV solver type, typically one of {@link #SHADOW} (the default),
137     * {@link #RIPPLE}, {@link #RIPPLE_TIGHT}, {@link #RIPPLE_LOOSE}, or {@link #RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE}.
138     * @param type
139     */
140    public FOV(int type) {
141        this.type = type;
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
146     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
147     * of fully lit.
148     *
149     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
150     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
151     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
152     * radius.
153     *
154     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
155     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
156     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
157     * @return the computed light grid
158     */
159    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty) {
160        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE);
161    }
162
163    /**
164     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
165     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
166     * of fully lit.
167     *
168     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
169     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
170     * calculations.
171     *
172     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
173     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
174     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
175     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
176     * @return the computed light grid
177     */
178    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startx, int starty, double radius) {
179        return calculateFOV(resistanceMap, startx, starty, radius, Radius.CIRCLE);
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
184     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
185     * of fully lit.
186     *
187     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
188     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
189     * RadiusStrategy.
190     *
191     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
192     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
193     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
194     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
195     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
196     * @return the computed light grid
197     */
198    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startX, int startY, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique) {
199        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
200
201        int width = resistanceMap.length;
202        int height = resistanceMap[0].length;
203
204        initializeLightMap(width, height);
205        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
206
207        switch (type) {
208            case RIPPLE:
209            case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
210            case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
211            case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
212                initializeNearLight(width, height);
213                doRippleFOV(light, rippleValue(type), startX, startY, decay, radius, resistanceMap, nearLight, radiusTechnique);
214                break;
215            default:
216                for (Direction d : Direction.DIAGONALS) {
217                    shadowCast(0, d.deltaX, d.deltaY, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
218                    shadowCast(d.deltaX, 0, 0, d.deltaY, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
219                }
220                break;
221        }
222        return light;
223    }
224
225        /**
226     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
227     * coordinates. Returns a light map where the values represent a percentage
228     * of fully lit.
229     *
230     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
231     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
232     * RadiusStrategy. A conical section of FOV is lit by this method if
233     * span is greater than 0.
234     *
235     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
236     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
237     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
238     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
239     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
240     * @param angle the angle in degrees that will be the center of the FOV cone, 0 points right
241     * @param span the angle in degrees that measures the full arc contained in the FOV cone
242     * @return the computed light grid
243     */
244    public double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, int startX, int startY, double radius,
245                                   Radius radiusTechnique, double angle, double span) {
246        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
247        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
248                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
249        span = span * 0.002777777777777778;
250        int width = resistanceMap.length;
251        int height = resistanceMap[0].length;
252
253        initializeLightMap(width, height);
254        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
255
256        switch (type) {
257            case RIPPLE:
258            case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
259            case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
260            case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
261                initializeNearLight(width, height);
262                doRippleFOV(light, rippleValue(type), startX, startY, decay, radius, resistanceMap, nearLight, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
263                break;
264            default:
265                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
266                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
267
268                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
269                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
270
271                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
272                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
273
274                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
275                light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
276                break;
277        }
278
279        return light;
280    }
281
282
283    /**
284     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
285     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
286     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
287     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
288     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
289     * {@code light} parameter.  The values in light are always cleared before
290     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
291     * <br>
292     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
293     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
294     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
295     * radius.
296     * <br>
297     * This static method is equivalent to the static method {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int)},
298     * but all of the overloads are called reuseFOV(), so this method name is discouraged for new code. Both delegate to
299     * {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)} anyway.
300     * 
301     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
302     * @param light a non-null 2D double array that will have its contents overwritten, modified, and returned
303     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
304     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
305     * @return the computed light grid (the same as {@code light})
306     */
307    public static double[][] calculateFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startx, int starty) {
308        return reuseFOV(resistanceMap, light, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE, Radius.CIRCLE);
309    }
310
311    /**
312     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
313     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
314     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
315     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
316     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
317     * {@code light} parameter.  The values in light are always cleared before
318     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
319     * <br>
320     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
321     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
322     * calculations. The light will be treated as having infinite possible
323     * radius.
324     * <br>
325     * This static method is equivalent to the static method {@link #calculateFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int)},
326     * but all of the overloads are called reuseFOV(), so this method name is preferred in new code. Both delegate to
327     * {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)} anyway.
328     *
329     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
330     * @param light a non-null 2D double array that will have its contents overwritten, modified, and returned
331     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
332     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
333     * @return the computed light grid (the same as {@code light})
334     */
335    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startx, int starty) {
336        return reuseFOV(resistanceMap, light, startx, starty, Integer.MAX_VALUE, Radius.CIRCLE);
337    }
338
339    /**
340     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
341     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
342     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
343     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
344     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
345     * {@code light} parameter. The values in light are always cleared before
346     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
347     * <br>
348     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
349     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations based on Euclidean
350     * calculations.
351     *
352     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
353     * @param startx the horizontal component of the starting location
354     * @param starty the vertical component of the starting location
355     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
356     * @return the computed light grid
357     */
358    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startx, int starty, double radius) {
359        return reuseFOV(resistanceMap, light, startx, starty, radius, Radius.CIRCLE);
360    }
361
362
363    /**
364     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
365     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
366     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
367     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
368     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
369     * {@code light} parameter. The values in light are always cleared before
370     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
371     * <br>
372     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
373     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
374     * RadiusStrategy.
375     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
376     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
377     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
378     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
379     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
380     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
381     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
382     */
383    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique)
384    {
385        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
386        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
387        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
388
389
390        shadowCast(0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
391        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
392
393        shadowCast(0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
394        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
395
396        shadowCast(0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
397        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
398
399        shadowCast(0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
400        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
401        return light;
402    }
403    /**
404     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
405     * coordinates. Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
406     * represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses shadowcasting FOV,
407     * which allows this method to be static since it doesn't need to keep any
408     * state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it via the
409     * {@code light} parameter. The values in light are always cleared before
410     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
411     * <br>
412     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
413     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
414     * RadiusStrategy.
415     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
416     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
417     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
418     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
419     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
420     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to calculate the radius as desired
421     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
422     */
423    public static double[][] reuseFOVSymmetrical(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique)
424    {
425        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
426        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
427        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
428
429
430        shadowCast(0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
431        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
432            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
433                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX - col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
434                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX - col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
435                    light[startX - col][startY - row] = 0.0;
436            }
437        }
438        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
439        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
440            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
441                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX - col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
442                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX - col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
443                    light[startX - col][startY - row] = 0.0;
444            }
445        }
446
447        shadowCast(0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
448        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
449            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
450                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY + row < light[0].length &&  resistanceMap[startX - col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
451                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX - col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
452                    light[startX - col][startY + row] = 0.0;
453            }
454        }
455        shadowCast(1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
456        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
457            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
458                if(startX - col >= 0 && startY + row < light[0].length && resistanceMap[startX - col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
459                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX - col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
460                    light[startX - col][startY + row] = 0.0;
461            }
462        }
463
464        shadowCast(0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
465        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
466            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
467                if(startX + col < light.length && startY + row < light[0].length && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
468                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX + col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
469                    light[startX + col][startY + row] = 0.0;
470            }
471        }
472        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
473        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
474            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
475                if(startX + col < light.length && startY + row < light[0].length && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY + row] < 1.0 &&
476                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX + col, startY + row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
477                    light[startX + col][startY + row] = 0.0;
478            }
479        }
480
481        shadowCast(0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
482        for (int row = 0; row <= radius + 1.0 && startY + row < light[0].length; row++) {
483            for (int col = Math.max(1,row); col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
484                if(startX + col < light.length && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
485                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX + col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
486                    light[startX + col][startY - row] = 0.0;
487            }
488        }
489        shadowCast(-1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique);
490        for (int col = 0; col <= radius + 1.0; col++) {
491            for (int row = Math.max(1,col); row <= radius + 1.0; row++) {
492                if(startX + col < light.length && startY - row >= 0 && resistanceMap[startX + col][startY - row] < 1.0 &&
493                        !shadowCastCheck(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX + col, startY - row, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length, startX, startY))
494                    light[startX + col][startY - row] = 0.0;
495            }
496        }
497        return light;
498    }
499    /**
500     * Calculates which cells have line of sight from the given x, y coordinates.
501     * Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
502     * are always either 0.0 for "not in line of sight" or 1.0 for "in line of
503     * sight," which doesn't mean a cell is actually visible if there's no light
504     * in that cell. Always uses shadowcasting FOV, which allows this method to
505     * be static since it doesn't need to keep any state around, and can reuse the
506     * state the user gives it via the {@code light} parameter. The values in light
507     * are always cleared before this is run, because prior state can make this give
508     * incorrect results.
509     * <br>
510     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
511     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are pretty much irrelevant because
512     * the distance doesn't matter, only the presence of a clear line, but this uses
513     * {@link Radius#SQUARE} if it matters.
514     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
515     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "no line"
516     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
517     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
518     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
519     */
520    public static double[][] reuseLOS(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY)
521    {
522        return reuseLOS(resistanceMap, light, startX, startY, 0, 0, light.length, light[0].length);
523    }
524    /**
525     * Calculates which cells have line of sight from the given x, y coordinates.
526     * Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values
527     * are always either 0.0 for "not in line of sight" or 1.0 for "in line of
528     * sight," which doesn't mean a cell is actually visible if there's no light
529     * in that cell. Always uses shadowcasting FOV, which allows this method to
530     * be static since it doesn't need to keep any state around, and can reuse the
531     * state the user gives it via the {@code light} parameter. The values in light
532     * are always cleared before this is run, because prior state can make this give
533     * incorrect results.
534     * <br>
535     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
536     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are pretty much irrelevant because
537     * the distance doesn't matter, only the presence of a clear line, but this uses
538     * {@link Radius#SQUARE} if it matters.
539     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
540     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "no line"
541     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
542     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
543     * @return the computed light grid, which is the same 2D array as the value assigned to {@code light}
544     */
545    public static double[][] reuseLOS(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY,
546                                      int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY)
547    {
548        double radius = light.length + light[0].length;
549        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
550        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
551        light[startX][startY] = 1;//make the starting space full power
552        
553        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
554        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
555        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
556        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
557        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
558        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
559        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
560        shadowCastBinary(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, Radius.SQUARE, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
561        
562        return light;
563    }
564    /**
565     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
566     * coordinates, lighting at the given angle in  degrees and covering a span
567     * centered on that angle, also in degrees. Assigns to, and returns, a light
568     * map where the values represent a percentage of fully lit. Always uses
569     * shadowcasting FOV, which allows this method to be static since it doesn't
570     * need to keep any state around, and can reuse the state the user gives it
571     * via the {@code light} parameter. The values in light are cleared before
572     * this is run, because prior state can make this give incorrect results.
573     * <br>
574     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
575     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
576     * RadiusStrategy.  A conical section of FOV is lit by this method if
577     * span is greater than 0.
578     *
579     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
580     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
581     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
582     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
583     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to
584     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to shape the FOV by changing distance calculation (circle, square, etc.)
585     * @param angle the angle in degrees that will be the center of the FOV cone, 0 points right
586     * @param span the angle in degrees that measures the full arc contained in the FOV cone
587     * @return the computed light grid
588     */
589    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY,
590                                          double radius, Radius radiusTechnique, double angle, double span) {
591        double decay = 1.0 / radius;
592        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
593        light[startX][startY] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
594        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
595                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
596        span = span * 0.002777777777777778;
597
598
599        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
600        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
601
602        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
603        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
604
605        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
606        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
607
608        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
609        light = shadowCastLimited(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, decay, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
610        return light;
611    }
612
613    /**
614     * Like the {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)} method, but this uses Ripple FOV
615     * with a configurable tightness/looseness (between 1, tightest, and 6, loosest). Other parameters are similar; you
616     * can get a resistance map from {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}, {@code light} will be modified and returned
617     * (it will be overwritten, but its size should be the same as the resistance map), there's a starting x,y position,
618     * a radius in cells, and a {@link Radius} enum constant to choose the distance measurement.
619     * @param resistanceMap probably calculated with {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}; 1.0 blocks light, 0.0 allows it
620     * @param light will be overwritten! Should be initialized with the same size as {@code resistanceMap}
621     * @param rippleLooseness affects spread; between 1 and 6, inclusive; 1 is tightest, 2 is normal, and 6 is loosest
622     * @param x starting x position to look from
623     * @param y starting y position to look from
624     * @param radius the distance to extend from the starting x,y position
625     * @param radiusTechnique how to measure distance; typically {@link Radius#CIRCLE}.
626     * @return {@code light}, after writing the FOV map into it; 1.0 is fully lit and 0.0 is unseen
627     */
628    public static double[][] reuseRippleFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int rippleLooseness, int x, int y, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique) {
629        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
630        light[x][y] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
631        lightWorkspace.resizeAndEmpty(light.length, light[0].length);
632        doRippleFOV(light, MathExtras.clamp(rippleLooseness, 1, 6), x, y, 1.0 / radius, radius, resistanceMap, lightWorkspace, radiusTechnique);
633        return light;
634    }
635
636    /**
637     * Like the {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius, double, double)} method, but this
638     * uses Ripple FOV with a configurable tightness/looseness (between 1, tightest, and 6, loosest). Other parameters
639     * are similar; you can get a resistance map from {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}, {@code light} will be
640     * modified and returned (it will be overwritten, but its size should be the same as the resistance map), there's 
641     * starting x,y position, a radius in cells, a {@link Radius} enum constant to choose the distance measurement, and
642     * the angle/span combination to specify a conical section of FOV (span is the total in degrees, centered on angle).
643     * @param resistanceMap probably calculated with {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}; 1.0 blocks light, 0.0 allows it
644     * @param light will be overwritten! Should be initialized with the same size as {@code resistanceMap}
645     * @param rippleLooseness affects spread; between 1 and 6, inclusive; 1 is tightest, 2 is normal, and 6 is loosest
646     * @param x starting x position to look from
647     * @param y starting y position to look from
648     * @param radius the distance to extend from the starting x,y position
649     * @param radiusTechnique how to measure distance; typically {@link Radius#CIRCLE}.
650     * @param angle the angle to center the conical FOV on
651     * @param span the total span in degrees for the conical FOV to cover
652     * @return {@code light}, after writing the FOV map into it; 1.0 is fully lit and 0.0 is unseen
653     */
654    public static double[][] reuseRippleFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int rippleLooseness, int x, int y, double radius, Radius radiusTechnique, double angle, double span) {
655        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
656        light[x][y] = Math.min(1.0, radius);//make the starting space full power unless radius is tiny
657        lightWorkspace.resizeAndEmpty(light.length, light[0].length);
658        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
659                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
660        span = span * 0.002777777777777778;
661        doRippleFOV(light, MathExtras.clamp(rippleLooseness, 1, 6), x, y, 1.0 / radius, radius, resistanceMap, lightWorkspace, radiusTechnique, angle, span);
662        return light;
663    }
664
665        /**
666         * Reuses the existing light 2D array and fills it with a straight-line bouncing path of light that reflects its way
667         * through the given resistanceMap from startX, startY until it uses up the given distance. The angle the path
668         * takes is given in degrees, and the angle used can change as obstacles are hit (reflecting backwards if it hits a
669         * corner pointing directly into or away from its path). This can be used something like an LOS method, but because
670         * the path can be traveled back over, an array or Queue becomes somewhat more complex, and the decreasing numbers
671         * for a straight line that stack may make more sense for how this could be used (especially with visual effects).
672         * This currently allows the path to pass through single-cell wall-like obstacles without changing direction, e.g.
673         * it passes through pillars, but will bounce if it hits a bigger wall.
674         * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
675         * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
676         * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
677         * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
678         * @param distance the distance the light will extend to
679         * @param angle in degrees, the angle to start the path traveling in
680         * @return the given light parameter, after modifications
681         */
682    public static double[][] bouncingLine(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY, double distance, double angle)
683    {
684        double rad = Math.max(1, distance);
685        double decay = 1.0 / rad;
686        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
687        light[startX][startY] = 1;//make the starting space full power
688        angle = Math.toRadians((angle > 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
689                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle);
690        float s = (float) NumberTools.sin(angle),
691                c = (float) NumberTools.cos(angle);
692        double deteriorate = 1.0;
693        int dx, dy, width = resistanceMap.length, height = resistanceMap[0].length;
694        for (int d = 1; d <= rad; ) {
695            dx = startX + Math.round(c * d);
696            if(dx < 0 || dx > width)
697                break;
698            dy = startY + Math.round(s * d);
699            if(dy < 0 || dy > height)
700                break;
701            deteriorate -= decay;
702            //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
703            if (deteriorate > 0.0) {
704                light[dx][dy] = Math.min(light[dx][dy] + deteriorate, 1.0);
705                if (resistanceMap[dx][dy] >= 1 && deteriorate > decay)
706                {
707                    startX = dx;
708                    startY = dy;
709                    d = 1;
710                    double flipX = resistanceMap[startX + Math.round(-c * d)][dy],
711                            flipY = resistanceMap[dx][startY + Math.round(-s * d)];
712                    if(flipX >= 1.0)
713                        s = -s;
714                    if(flipY >= 1.0)
715                        c = -c;
716                }
717                else ++d;
718
719            }
720            else break;
721        }
722
723        return light;
724    }
725    /**
726         * @param width
727         *            The width that {@link #light} should have.
728         * @param height
729         *            The height that {@link #light} should have.
730         */
731        private void initializeLightMap(int width, int height) {
732                if (light == null)
733                        light = new double[width][height];
734                else {
735                        if (light.length != width || light[0].length != height)
736                                /* Size changed */
737                                light = new double[width][height];
738                        else {
739                                /*
740                                 * Size did not change, we simply need to erase the previous
741                                 * result
742                                 */
743                                ArrayTools.fill(light, 0.0);
744                        }
745                }
746        }
747
748        /**
749         * @param width
750         *            The width that {@link #nearLight} should have.
751         * @param height
752         *            The height that {@link #nearLight} should have.
753         */
754        private void initializeNearLight(int width, int height) {
755                if (nearLight == null) {
756                    /* Can't do much with null */
757            nearLight = new GreasedRegion(width, height);
758        }
759                else {
760                        if (nearLight.width != width || nearLight.height != height) {
761                /* Size changed */
762                nearLight.resizeAndEmpty(width, height);
763            }
764                        else {
765                                /*
766                                 * Size did not change, we simply need to erase the previous
767                                 * result
768                                 */
769                                nearLight.clear();
770                        }
771                }
772        }
773
774        private static int rippleValue(int type) {
775                switch (type) {
776                case RIPPLE:
777                        return 2;
778                case RIPPLE_LOOSE:
779                        return 3;
780                case RIPPLE_TIGHT:
781                        return 1;
782                case RIPPLE_VERY_LOOSE:
783                        return 6;
784                default:
785                        System.err.println("Unrecognized ripple type: " + type + ". Defaulting to RIPPLE");
786                        return 2;
787                }
788        }
789
790    private static void doRippleFOV(double[][] lightMap, int ripple, int x, int y, double decay, double radius, double[][] map, GreasedRegion indirect, Radius radiusStrategy) {
791        dq.clear();
792        int width = lightMap.length;
793        int height = lightMap[0].length;
794        dq.offer(Coord.get(x, y));
795        while (!dq.isEmpty()) {
796            Coord p = dq.removeFirst();
797            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] <= 0 || indirect.contains(p)) {
798                continue;//no light to spread
799            }
800
801            for (Direction dir : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
802                int x2 = p.x + dir.deltaX;
803                int y2 = p.y + dir.deltaY;
804                if (x2 < 0 || x2 >= width || y2 < 0 || y2 >= height //out of bounds
805                        || radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, x2, y2) >= radius + 1) {//+1 to cover starting tile
806                    continue;
807                }
808
809                double surroundingLight = nearRippleLight(x2, y2, ripple, x, y, decay, lightMap, map, indirect, radiusStrategy);
810                if (lightMap[x2][y2] < surroundingLight) {
811                    lightMap[x2][y2] = surroundingLight;
812                    if (map[x2][y2] < 1) {//make sure it's not a wall
813                        dq.offer(Coord.get(x2, y2));//redo neighbors since this one's light changed
814                    }
815                }
816            }
817        }
818    }
819
820
821
822    private static void doRippleFOV(double[][] lightMap, int ripple, int x, int y, double decay, double radius, double[][] map, GreasedRegion indirect, Radius radiusStrategy, double angle, double span) {
823            dq.clear();
824        int width = lightMap.length;
825        int height = lightMap[0].length;
826        dq.offer(Coord.get(x, y));
827        while (!dq.isEmpty()) {
828            Coord p = dq.removeFirst();
829            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] <= 0 || indirect.contains(p)) {
830                continue;//no light to spread
831            }
832
833            for (Direction dir : ccw_full) {
834                int x2 = p.x + dir.deltaX;
835                int y2 = p.y + dir.deltaY;
836                if (x2 < 0 || x2 >= width || y2 < 0 || y2 >= height //out of bounds
837                        || radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, x2, y2) >= radius + 1) {//+1 to cover starting tile
838                    continue;
839                }
840                double newAngle = NumberTools.atan2_(y2 - y, x2 - x) - angle;
841                newAngle -= Noise.fastFloor(newAngle);
842                if (newAngle > span * 0.5f && newAngle < 1.0f - span * 0.5f)
843                    continue;
844
845                double surroundingLight = nearRippleLight(x2, y2, ripple, x, y, decay, lightMap, map, indirect, radiusStrategy );
846                if (lightMap[x2][y2] < surroundingLight) {
847                    lightMap[x2][y2] = surroundingLight;
848                    if (map[x2][y2] < 1) {//make sure it's not a wall
849                        dq.offer(Coord.get(x2, y2));//redo neighbors since this one's light changed
850                    }
851                }
852            }
853        }
854    }
855
856    private static final ArrayList<Coord> neighbors = new ArrayList<Coord>(8);
857
858    private static double nearRippleLight(int x, int y, int rippleNeighbors, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap, double[][] map, GreasedRegion indirect, Radius radiusStrategy) {
859        if (x == startx && y == starty) {
860            return 1;
861        }
862        int width = lightMap.length;
863        int height = lightMap[0].length;
864        neighbors.clear();
865        double tmpDistance = 0, testDistance;
866        Coord c;
867        for (Direction di : Direction.OUTWARDS) {
868            int x2 = x + di.deltaX;
869            int y2 = y + di.deltaY;
870            if (x2 >= 0 && x2 < width && y2 >= 0 && y2 < height) {
871                tmpDistance = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, x2, y2);
872                int idx = 0;
873                for(int i = 0; i < neighbors.size() && i <= rippleNeighbors; i++)
874                {
875                    c = neighbors.get(i);
876                    testDistance = radiusStrategy.radius(startx, starty, c.x, c.y);
877                    if(tmpDistance < testDistance) {
878                        break;
879                    }
880                    idx++;
881                }
882                neighbors.add(idx, Coord.get(x2, y2));
883            }
884        }
885
886        if (neighbors.isEmpty()) {
887            return 0;
888        }
889        int max = Math.min(neighbors.size(), rippleNeighbors);
890        double light = 0;
891        int lit = 0, indirects = 0;
892        for (int i = 0; i < max; i++) {
893            Coord p = neighbors.get(i);
894            if (lightMap[p.x][p.y] > 0) {
895                lit++;
896                if (indirect.contains(p)) {
897                    indirects++;
898                }
899                double dist = radiusStrategy.radius(x, y, p.x, p.y);
900                light = Math.max(light, lightMap[p.x][p.y] - dist * decay - map[p.x][p.y]);
901            }
902        }
903
904        if (map[x][y] >= 1 || indirects >= lit) {
905            indirect.insert(x, y);
906        }
907        return light;
908    }
909
910    private static void shadowCast(int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
911                                   double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
912                                   double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy) {
913            shadowCast(1, 1.0, 0.0, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay, lightMap, map, radiusStrategy,
914                0, 0, lightMap.length, lightMap[0].length);
915    }
916
917    private static void shadowCastBinary(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
918                                         double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
919                                         double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy,
920                                         int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY) {
921        double newStart = 0;
922        if (start < end) {
923            return;
924        }
925
926        boolean blocked = false;
927        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < maxX - minX + maxY - minY && !blocked; distance++) {
928            int deltaY = -distance;
929            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
930                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
931                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
932                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
933                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
934
935                if (!(currentX >= minX && currentY >= minY && currentX < maxX && currentY < maxY) || start < rightSlope) {
936                    continue;
937                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
938                    break;
939                }
940
941                lightMap[currentX][currentY] = 1.0;
942
943                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
944                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
945                        newStart = rightSlope;
946                    } else {
947                        blocked = false;
948                        start = newStart;
949                    }
950                } else {
951                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
952                        blocked = true;
953                        shadowCastBinary(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay,
954                                lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
955                        newStart = rightSlope;
956                    }
957                }
958            }
959        }
960    }
961
962    private static boolean shadowCastCheck(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
963                                         double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
964                                         double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy,
965                                         int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY, int targetX, int targetY) {
966        double newStart = 0;
967        if (start < end) {
968            return false;
969        }
970
971        boolean blocked = false;
972        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < maxX - minX + maxY - minY && !blocked; distance++) {
973            int deltaY = -distance;
974            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
975                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
976                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
977                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
978                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
979
980                if (!(currentX >= minX && currentY >= minY && currentX < maxX && currentY < maxY) || start < rightSlope) {
981                    continue;
982                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
983                    break;
984                }
985
986                if(currentX == targetX && currentY == targetY) return true;
987
988                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
989                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1.0) {//hit a wall
990                        newStart = rightSlope;
991                    } else {
992                        blocked = false;
993                        start = newStart;
994                    }
995                } else {
996                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1.0 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
997                        blocked = true;
998                        if(shadowCastCheck(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay,
999                                lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, minX, minY, maxX, maxY, targetX, targetY))
1000                            return true;
1001                        newStart = rightSlope;
1002                    }
1003                }
1004            }
1005        }
1006        return false;
1007    }
1008
1009    private static void shadowCast(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
1010                                   double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
1011                                   double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy,
1012                                   int minX, int minY, int maxX, int maxY) {
1013        double newStart = 0;
1014        if (start < end) {
1015            return;
1016        }
1017
1018        boolean blocked = false;
1019        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < maxX - minX + maxY - minY && !blocked; distance++) {
1020            int deltaY = -distance;
1021            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
1022                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
1023                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
1024                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
1025                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
1026
1027                if (!(currentX >= minX && currentY >= minY && currentX < maxX && currentY < maxY) || start < rightSlope) {
1028                    continue;
1029                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
1030                    break;
1031                }
1032                double deltaRadius = radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY);
1033                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
1034                if (deltaRadius <= radius) {
1035                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = 1.0 - decay * deltaRadius; 
1036                }
1037
1038                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
1039                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
1040                        newStart = rightSlope;
1041                    } else {
1042                        blocked = false;
1043                        start = newStart;
1044                    }
1045                } else {
1046                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
1047                        blocked = true;
1048                        shadowCast(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay,
1049                                lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, minX, minY, maxX, maxY);
1050                        newStart = rightSlope;
1051                    }
1052                }
1053            }
1054        }
1055    }
1056    private static double[][] shadowCastLimited(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
1057                                                double radius, int startx, int starty, double decay, double[][] lightMap,
1058                                                double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy, double angle, double span) {
1059        double newStart = 0;
1060        if (start < end) {
1061            return lightMap;
1062        }
1063        int width = lightMap.length;
1064        int height = lightMap[0].length;
1065
1066        boolean blocked = false;
1067        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < width + height && !blocked; distance++) {
1068            int deltaY = -distance;
1069            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
1070                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
1071                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
1072                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
1073                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
1074
1075                if (!(currentX >= 0 && currentY >= 0 && currentX < width && currentY < height) || start < rightSlope) {
1076                    continue;
1077                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
1078                    break;
1079                }
1080                double deltaRadius = radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY),
1081                        at2 = Math.abs(angle - NumberTools.atan2_(currentY - starty, currentX - startx));// + 1.0) % 1.0;
1082                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
1083                if (deltaRadius <= radius
1084                        && (at2 <= span * 0.5
1085                        || at2 >= 1.0 - span * 0.5)) {
1086                    double bright = 1 - decay * deltaRadius;
1087                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = bright;
1088                }
1089
1090                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
1091                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
1092                        newStart = rightSlope;
1093                    } else {
1094                        blocked = false;
1095                        start = newStart;
1096                    }
1097                } else {
1098                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < radius) {//hit a wall within sight line
1099                        blocked = true;
1100                        lightMap = shadowCastLimited(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, decay, lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, angle, span);
1101                        newStart = rightSlope;
1102                    }
1103                }
1104            }
1105        }
1106        return lightMap;
1107    }
1108
1109    private static final double[] directionRanges = new double[8];
1110    /**
1111     * Calculates the Field Of View for the provided map from the given x, y
1112     * coordinates, lighting with the view "pointed at" the given {@code angle} in degrees,
1113     * extending to different ranges based on the direction the light is traveling.
1114     * The direction ranges are {@code forward}, {@code sideForward}, {@code side},
1115     * {@code sideBack}, and {@code back}; all are multiplied by {@code radius}.
1116     * Assigns to, and returns, a light map where the values represent a percentage of fully
1117     * lit. The values in light are cleared before this is run, because prior state can make
1118     * this give incorrect results. You can use {@link #addFOVsInto(double[][], double[][]...)}
1119     * if you want to mix FOV results, which works as an alternative to using the prior light state.
1120     * <br>
1121     * The starting point for the calculation is considered to be at the center
1122     * of the origin cell. Radius determinations are determined by the provided
1123     * RadiusStrategy. If all direction ranges are the same, this acts like
1124     * {@link #reuseFOV(double[][], double[][], int, int, double, Radius)}; otherwise
1125     * may produce conical shapes (potentially more than one, or overlapping ones).
1126     *
1127     * @param resistanceMap the grid of cells to calculate on; the kind made by {@link #generateResistances(char[][])}
1128     * @param light the grid of cells to assign to; may have existing values, and 0.0 is used to mean "unlit"
1129     * @param startX the horizontal component of the starting location
1130     * @param startY the vertical component of the starting location
1131     * @param radius the distance the light will extend to (roughly); direction ranges will be multiplied by this
1132     * @param radiusTechnique provides a means to shape the FOV by changing distance calculation (circle, square, etc.)
1133     * @param angle the angle in degrees that will be the center of the FOV cone, 0 points right
1134     * @param forward the range to extend when the light is within 22.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with sideForward
1135     * @param sideForward the range to extend when the light is between 22.5 and 67.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with forward or side
1136     * @param side the range to extend when the light is between 67.5 and 112.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with sideForward or sideBack
1137     * @param sideBack the range to extend when the light is between 112.5 and 157.5 degrees of angle; will be interpolated with side or back
1138     * @param back the range to extend when the light is more than 157.5 degrees away from angle; will be interpolated with sideBack
1139     * @return the computed light grid (the same as {@code light})
1140     */
1141    public static double[][] reuseFOV(double[][] resistanceMap, double[][] light, int startX, int startY,
1142                                      double radius, Radius radiusTechnique, double angle,
1143                                      double forward, double sideForward, double side, double sideBack, double back) {
1144        directionRanges[0] = forward * radius;
1145        directionRanges[7] = directionRanges[1] = sideForward * radius;
1146        directionRanges[6] = directionRanges[2] = side * radius;
1147        directionRanges[5] = directionRanges[3] = sideBack * radius;
1148        directionRanges[4] = back * radius;
1149
1150        radius = Math.max(1, radius);
1151        ArrayTools.fill(light, 0);
1152        light[startX][startY] = 1;//make the starting space full power
1153        angle = ((angle >= 360.0 || angle < 0.0)
1154                ? MathExtras.remainder(angle, 360.0) : angle) * 0.002777777777777778;
1155
1156
1157        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, 1, 0,   radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1158        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, 1,   radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1159        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, 1, 0,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1160        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, 1,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1161        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, -1, -1, 0, radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1162        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, -1, 0, 0, -1, radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1163        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 0, 1, -1, 0,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1164        light = shadowCastPersonalized(1, 1.0, 0.0, 1, 0, 0, -1,  radius, startX, startY, light, resistanceMap, radiusTechnique, angle, directionRanges);
1165        return light;
1166    }
1167
1168    private static double[][] shadowCastPersonalized(int row, double start, double end, int xx, int xy, int yx, int yy,
1169                                                     double radius, int startx, int starty, double[][] lightMap,
1170                                                     double[][] map, Radius radiusStrategy, double angle, final double[] directionRanges) {
1171        double newStart = 0;
1172        if (start < end) {
1173            return lightMap;
1174        }
1175        int width = lightMap.length;
1176        int height = lightMap[0].length;
1177
1178        boolean blocked = false;
1179        for (int distance = row; distance <= radius && distance < width + height && !blocked; distance++) {
1180            int deltaY = -distance;
1181            for (int deltaX = -distance; deltaX <= 0; deltaX++) {
1182                int currentX = startx + deltaX * xx + deltaY * xy;
1183                int currentY = starty + deltaX * yx + deltaY * yy;
1184                double leftSlope = (deltaX - 0.5f) / (deltaY + 0.5f);
1185                double rightSlope = (deltaX + 0.5f) / (deltaY - 0.5f);
1186
1187                if (!(currentX >= 0 && currentY >= 0 && currentX < width && currentY < height) || start < rightSlope) {
1188                    continue;
1189                } else if (end > leftSlope) {
1190                    break;
1191                }
1192                double at2 = Math.abs(angle - NumberTools.atan2_(currentY - starty, currentX - startx)) * 8.0,
1193                        deltaRadius = radiusStrategy.radius(deltaX, deltaY);
1194                int ia = (int)(at2), low = ia & 7, high = ia + 1 & 7;
1195                double a = at2 - ia, adjRadius = (1.0 - a) * directionRanges[low] + a * directionRanges[high];
1196                //check if it's within the lightable area and light if needed
1197                if (deltaRadius <= adjRadius) {
1198                    lightMap[currentX][currentY] = 1.0 - (deltaRadius / (adjRadius + 1.0)); // how bright the tile is
1199                }
1200
1201                if (blocked) { //previous cell was a blocking one
1202                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1) {//hit a wall
1203                        newStart = rightSlope;
1204                    } else {
1205                        blocked = false;
1206                        start = newStart;
1207                    }
1208                } else {
1209                    if (map[currentX][currentY] >= 1 && distance < adjRadius) {//hit a wall within sight line
1210                        blocked = true;
1211                        lightMap = shadowCastPersonalized(distance + 1, start, leftSlope, xx, xy, yx, yy, radius, startx, starty, lightMap, map, radiusStrategy, angle, directionRanges);
1212                        newStart = rightSlope;
1213                    }
1214                }
1215            }
1216        }
1217        return lightMap;
1218    }
1219
1220    /**
1221     * Adds an FOV map to another in the simplest way possible; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1222     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Modifies the basis parameter in-place and makes no
1223     * allocations; this is different from {@link #addFOVs(double[][][])}, which creates a new 2D array.
1224     * @param basis a 2D double array, which can be empty or returned by calculateFOV() or reuseFOV(); modified!
1225     * @param addend another 2D double array that will be added into basis; this one will not be modified
1226     * @return the sum of the 2D double arrays passed, using the dimensions of basis if they don't match
1227     */
1228    public static double[][] addFOVsInto(double[][] basis, double[][] addend)
1229    {
1230        for (int x = 0; x < basis.length && x < addend.length; x++) {
1231                for (int y = 0; y < basis[x].length && y < addend[x].length; y++) {
1232                    basis[x][y] = Math.min(1.0, basis[x][y] + addend[x][y]);
1233                }
1234            }
1235        return basis;
1236    }
1237    /**
1238     * Adds multiple FOV maps together in the simplest way possible; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1239     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Allocates a new 2D double array and returns it.
1240     * @param maps an array or vararg of 2D double arrays, each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1241     * @return the sum of all the 2D double arrays passed, using the dimensions of the first if they don't all match
1242     */
1243    public static double[][] addFOVs(double[][]... maps)
1244    {
1245        if(maps == null || maps.length == 0)
1246            return new double[0][0];
1247        double[][] map = ArrayTools.copy(maps[0]);
1248        for(int i = 1; i < maps.length; i++)
1249        {
1250            for (int x = 0; x < map.length && x < maps[i].length; x++) {
1251                for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length && y < maps[i][x].length; y++) {
1252                    map[x][y] += maps[i][x][y];
1253                }
1254            }
1255        }
1256        for (int x = 0; x < map.length; x++) {
1257            for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length; y++) {
1258                if(map[x][y] > 1.0) map[x][y] = 1.0;
1259            }
1260        }
1261        return map;
1262    }
1263    /**
1264     * Adds multiple FOV maps to basis cell-by-cell, modifying basis; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1265     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Returns basis without allocating new objects.
1266     * @param basis a 2D double array that will be modified by adding values in maps to it and clamping to 1.0 or less 
1267     * @param maps an array or vararg of 2D double arrays, each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1268     * @return basis, with all elements in all of maps added to the corresponding cells and clamped
1269     */
1270    public static double[][] addFOVsInto(double[][] basis, double[][]... maps) {
1271        if (maps == null || maps.length == 0)
1272            return basis;
1273        for (int i = 1; i < maps.length; i++) {
1274            for (int x = 0; x < basis.length && x < maps[i].length; x++) {
1275                for (int y = 0; y < basis[x].length && y < maps[i][x].length; y++) {
1276                    basis[x][y] += maps[i][x][y];
1277                }
1278            }
1279        }
1280        for (int x = 0; x < basis.length; x++) {
1281            for (int y = 0; y < basis[x].length; y++) {
1282                if (basis[x][y] > 1.0) basis[x][y] = 1.0;
1283            }
1284        }
1285        return basis;
1286    }
1287
1288    /**
1289     * Adds multiple FOV maps together in the simplest way possible; does not check line-of-sight between FOV maps.
1290     * Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0. Allocates a new 2D double array and returns it.
1291     * @param maps an Iterable of 2D double arrays (most collections implement Iterable),
1292     *             each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1293     * @return the sum of all the 2D double arrays passed, using the dimensions of the first if they don't all match
1294     */
1295    public static double[][] addFOVs(Iterable<double[][]> maps)
1296    {
1297        if(maps == null)
1298            return new double[0][0];
1299        Iterator<double[][]> it = maps.iterator();
1300        if(!it.hasNext())
1301            return new double[0][0];
1302        double[][] map = ArrayTools.copy(it.next()), t;
1303        while (it.hasNext())
1304        {
1305            t = it.next();
1306            for (int x = 0; x < map.length && x < t.length; x++) {
1307                for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length && y < t[x].length; y++) {
1308                    map[x][y] += t[x][y];
1309                }
1310            }
1311        }
1312        for (int x = 0; x < map.length; x++) {
1313            for (int y = 0; y < map[x].length; y++) {
1314                if(map[x][y] > 1.0) map[x][y] = 1.0;
1315            }
1316        }
1317        return map;
1318    }
1319
1320    /**
1321     * Adds together multiple FOV maps, but only adds to a position if it is visible in the given LOS map. Useful if
1322     * you want distant lighting to be visible only if the player has line-of-sight to a lit cell. Typically the LOS map
1323     * is calculated by {@link #reuseLOS(double[][], double[][], int, int)}, using the same resistance map used to
1324     * calculate the FOV maps. Clamps the highest value for any single position at 1.0.
1325     * @param losMap an LOS map such as one generated by {@link #reuseLOS(double[][], double[][], int, int)}
1326     * @param maps an array or vararg of 2D double arrays, each usually returned by calculateFOV()
1327     * @return the sum of all the 2D double arrays in maps where a cell was visible in losMap
1328     */
1329    public static double[][] mixVisibleFOVs(double[][] losMap, double[][]... maps)
1330    {
1331        if(losMap == null || losMap.length == 0)
1332            return addFOVs(maps);
1333        final int width = losMap.length, height = losMap[0].length;
1334        double[][] map = new double[width][height];
1335        if(maps == null || maps.length == 0)
1336            return map;
